DefaultDialogue: New face, old story. The wheel grinds on, grinds us down, doesn't it?
I offer you nothing, but you remain. I can give you a name, if that would help. \n\nSome have called me Yonas. There are other names, but they will not speak themselves. One is enough, I think.
That was an invigorating climb. My body is so much younger than my head.
This place is familiar. My feet remember what my mind does not. \n\nHave you found any new voices, haunted one?
The ghosts are loud here... this place remembers sorrow. My bones rattle with it. \n\nYou went into the cave. What did you find?
Something ended here. Grief soaks this garment. My own, somehow. It is mine and not mine. \n\nThe flesh forgets but the cloth remembers.

Carts and wanderers, adventurers and fortune-seekers. They pass these ruins thinking only of safety, riches, and dust. \n\nHow could they know what this place was? Sacred for some, hopelessly tragic for others.

But there are answers here, a path that leads where many have sought to go, those who would stand against the Corruption. \n\nYou speak of that voice that assaults your mind... this path may be the only way to see it silenced.
These fish and I, we have a history. My lure doesn't attract their attention much, but I enjoy spending time with them all the same. \n\nIf I really want to catch fish, there are other spots not far.
Continue your journey, traveler. The fish have grown clever here. \n\nAh, but you are familiar. Two voices, one mind. Yes, we've spoken before. What brings you to my hovel?

I truly am the last. All that the Order was, all that it will be, in this decaying mind of mine. \n\nYou've rested your faith in me, but it is unfounded, and there is nowhere else you will find the strength you seek to leverage.
I remember that she was beautiful, and terrifying, and ancient, even when I was young…

We have but one component of our conduit. Vital though it may be, we must now craft the staff that will contain it. \n\nThrough it, you will draw on the power of your own soul to destroy Corruption where it stands.
For the next component of the azoth staff, you must acquire one of our consecrated crosspieces. \n\nIt will be tricky, however, as there are certainly none of these just lying about in an old chest.

I fear there is little time left to prepare you for what approaches. \n\nWhile you were away, I met a traveler who spoke of Corrupted coming down from the north. I suspect they are driven on by the same voice that plagues your mind.
I have had time to give our predicament some thought. \n\nWhile we now possess an azoth staff, it is but a beginning, and even armed with such an implement, we two are no bulwark against Corruption.
Seeing is believing. They may not understand what you hold in your hand, but you can teach them with your deeds.
Don't say I didn't warn you now, but you get used to it, sort of. \n\nThere is just one more thing you need before you can be anointed as a Soulwarden.
Hm. I should probably mention that there is another way to acquire a Heartgem.\n\nYou would need to forge it yourself, however, and the components may be tedious to track down.
I wish they had not delved into this sacred place, but it is serendipitous in a way. \n\nIt is much harder to create a Heartgem than it is to find one.
A Soulwarden's power comes from creating distance in your soul, like a firebreak in the forest. \n\nThe Heartgem provides that barrier, inuring your soul against Corruption.
The Initiation of a new Soulwarden once called for a feast attended by the entire order.\n\nBut with just the two of us, I suspect it would make for a rather dull affair.
Fancy meeting you here! Come to enjoy the view? \n\nSomething tells me there are riches to be had here.
Thought I heard scuffling in those ruins. I was thinking there might be some treasure in there. \n\nBut you don't look like you found something, you look like you're still searching.
This is my kind of town. Color, opulence, fashion… thievery, gossip, drama… \n\nJust the sort of place that rewards the ambition of a woman trying to seek her fortune.
Did you find your rambling old man? Surely someone in this town knows where to find him. \n\nEither way, don't be a stranger. I'm working on a little deal that could earn us some real coin.
My hunch about this town was right. Did you know the jewelers deal in gold plating? These pampered city-folk truly can't tell the difference. \n\nBut what have you been up to?
While you flitter off in search of a myth, I'll be enjoying the company of my betters. \n\nTheir doting affection will be right profitable, I'm betting.
Couldn't help but overhear you talking to that Magistrate fellow. \n\nIt's a waste of time talking to such fools. Their power is getting others to do things, not doing it themselves.
You're a real puzzle, you know? Delving into ruins and danger to rescue a town that can't be bothered to rescue itself. \n\nSome day I'd like to know just what's knocking about in that head of yours.

I have to hand it to you, you're turning into quite the hero. 

Running off into the woods after a ghost, returning determined to battle those red-eyed demons, and now I hear that SOMEONE beat back the Corrupted in the north. 

Now who could that be, I wonder?
You should not be in these parts, human. \n\nThis land is wounded, and it will not hesitate to deal with trespassers.
You say you've come to see me, but I see only darkness dwelling behind your eyes. \n\nThe actions of your kind have already tainted this place, so what purpose have you now.
You have done your part, so I will hear what you came here to say. \n\nBut I warn you - I have no sympathy for the plight of humans in the battle against Corruption. It is not our fight.
Your sincerity has impressed me. That is the only reason we are still speaking. \n\nBut I think it will take more than sincerity to earn the trust of the Angry Earth.
Return to your instructor. Convey to him that our gift, and the reprieve that comes with it, is not without condition. \n\nShould your kind abuse it, we will visit our wrath upon you.
There is nothing else for you right now. You should begone from here. \n\nBut… I do wish you good fortune in your future travels.

Everyone in this town has lost their minds. What could be more important than an army pressing down from the north? \n\nDo not get me started on the squabbles of the Factions. Short sighted fools, all of them!

Ah, the old man Yonas, right? Yes, he passes through often, always raving about Corruption. \n\nHe lives outside the walls, in a cabin to the east. Be careful if you're headed that way, or at least don't say I didn't warn you.

Ah, the old man Yonas, right? Yes, he passes through often, always raving about Corruption. \n\nHe lives outside the walls, in a cabin to the east. Be careful if you're headed that way, or at least don't say I didn't warn you.
Keep your nose out of trouble, traveler. I do not need another problem on my plate.
Good luck in your search. Though I do warn you - there have been Corrupted seen in the north.\n\nIf you see any of those red-eyed monsters, I'd suggest steering clear.

The fact that you are still standing here suggests there's something you haven't told me. \n\nIf it's about the Corrupted coming, I already know, but these others, they won't understand the danger until it's too late.
I would not have believed it, if it had not happened so soon after your departure. \n\nWe have new cause for hope in you, my friend, and I am now spreading the word.
Anwir Hughes is at it again, is he? \n\nThe man's mostly harmless, but if I have to listen to you read one of his sales pitches, you can keep walking.

I overheard a melody floating on the wind. I confess, I am not much for the arts myself. My hands can do little more than bear a weapon, but I can appreciate mastery when I hear it. \n\nWill you play it again for me?
It is even more stirring with you before me. \n\nWhere did you come by this song? Did you compose it?
If you've come to grease my palms about a permit, demand my aid in a petty squabble, or accuse me of some insane crime, then move along. \n\nI am afraid I am VERY busy today.
I know a nose sniffing for information when I see one. I have certainly lived here long enough. \n\nWell, get on with it then. What do you want to know about?
Adiana tells us you have come here to seek our boon. \n\nWe are not easily given to trust, especially with your kind digging, burning, destroying wherever you go.
We have granted the boon you seek. \n\nOur debt to you is discharged, and we will not hesitate to hunt you should our paths cross again.
